q: December, Barack Obama reportedly called the owner of the Philadelphia Eagles to support the team's willingness to give Michael Vick a second chance. The Eagles' commitment to Michael Vick has been clear since they signed him in 2009: If a person made a terrible mistake and then paid their debts to society, was deeply remorseful and turned their life around completely... would you be willing to help this human being move forward? Despite these public displays of support, Michael Vick has faced intense scrutiny and criticism since his 2007 arrest and conviction for a series of crimes related to dog fighting. This is something worth singing about: The winner of Fox's upcoming singing competition series will receive a hefty$ 5 million grand prize- the largest in television history- the network announced Monday. We are going to put our money where our mouths are with the$ 5 million recording contract, executive producer Simon Cowell said in a statement.`` I'm doing this show in America because I genuinely believe we can find a superstar.''
